definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: May Day is the International Labor Day.
A large-scale “blind date” fair will be held at People's Square on this Labor Day.
sentences.chinese: 这个劳动节在人民广场会举行一场大型的公开相亲会。

sentences.english: Thousands of people come to Beijing for a visit during May Day.
sentences.chinese: 五一国际劳动节期间，数以千计的人来北京参观。

sentences.english: 1894 - Labor Day becomes an official US holiday.
sentences.chinese: 1894年的今天，劳动节成为美国的官方节假日。

sentences.english: I hope to put it on before May Day.
sentences.chinese: 我希望它在五一劳动节之前能够上演。

sentences.english: Labor's Day stems from Chicago workers' general strike.
sentences.chinese: 五一“国际劳动节源于美国芝加哥的工人大罢工。

sentences.english: the girl chosen queen of a May Day festival.
sentences.chinese: 被选作国际劳动节女王的女孩。

sentences.english: Paris workers will parade on May Day.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎工人将在五一劳动节举行游行。

sentences.english: President Bush has sent his greeting to the millions of Americans who will celebrate the Labor Day holiday Monday.
sentences.chinese: 布什总统派问候祝贺美国人假期星期一庆祝劳动节。

sentences.english: Your Labor Day is on the first Monday of September, right?
sentences.chinese: 九月的第一个礼拜一是你们的劳动节是吗？

sentences.english: Today is the second day of the holiday for Labout day, there was warm sunshine everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 今天是五一劳动节的第二天，到处都是温暖的阳光。

sentences.english: You can see my photos from the Labour Day holiday.
sentences.chinese: 你可以看我在劳动节时拍的照片。

sentences.english: Labor Day weekend had gone, and Indian Summer was coming, whatever that is.
sentences.chinese: 周末的劳动节已经过去了，就快到小阳春了，管它呢。

sentences.english: Congress passed a law which made Labor Day a national holiday.
sentences.chinese: 国会通过了一项定劳动节为国家假日的法律。

sentences.english: Now the pilot furloughs will start after Labor Day.
sentences.chinese: 对飞行员在劳动节后开始。

sentences.english: He did not even rest on Labor's Day.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至连劳动节都不休息。

definition: Dragon Boat Festival (5th day of the 5th lunar month)
Qingming or Pure Brightness Festival or Tomb Sweeping Day, celebration for the dead (in early April)
to compensate for working on a holiday by resting on a workday/to compensate for resting on a workday by working on a holiday
to have a holiday or vacation
the Mid-Autumn Festival on 15th of 8th lunar month
Youth Day (May 4th), PRC national holiday for young people aged 14 to 28, who get half a day off
